title: Barclays is getting tantalisingly close to the point where it is no longer destroying shareholder value
text:
Revenues are nice and profits are nicer but if you want to prove yourself as a bank – and put a troublesome activist investor back in his box – then punchy returns on tangible equity really are the thing to be aiming for.

In the short opening statement that Barclays released accompanying its third quarter results this morning, the acronym "RoTE" appears 11 times, including four times in the first three lines. The statement by chief executive Jes Staley, which is only around 300 words long, mentions it a further five times.
